Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: SNGV
Reviews.Content: Remembering my last experience with Julia Hotel in 2008 I was hoping for at least the same quality. Back then I found the hotel adequate for the money they charged. Even their shared bathroom was clean and nice. This March I stayed at Julia again (as it was chosen by my friends I have been travelling with). I must say that their reception personnel are as good as they were in 2008. They are friendly and helpful and attentive! No complaints here! As to all other aspects the hotel has been a real disappointment! The two things that struck me most were: 1. Cockroaches in the bathroom. They were of different sizes (mostly small ones) and during every visit to bathroom I was killing at least a couple. 2. The hotel has serious problems with water supply system. You just can’t take a normal shower. The water keeps changing temperature from hot to ice cold. And on one of the mornings hot water stopped running at all. We could not even take a normal shower, not to mention washing our hair! You can imagine how disappointing this was! Sleep quality was bad. One of our matrasses was worn out and knobby, the other was sliding off the bed all the time. Breakfasts were manageable, but really nothing special. One day ham smelled really funny and was cut in a suspicious way. I did not take the risk eating it. I really hate to write these terrible things about this hotel. But I hope it would induce their management to get rid of insects in the rooms and to place boilers (which are not really expensive) so that guests could count on such basic things as hot shower. This is not a 3-star hotel! And I will not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Theo H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good, clean and simple hotel. New pillow slips every day and new towels. Perfect place to sleep when visiting Rome to explore the city. Good breakfast also! Which is rare in Rome. 4 minute walk to Barberini subway station. 6 minute walk to Trevi fountain. Travel tip: To return to Ciampino Airport travel from Barberini to Anagnina, the end of line A, then take the bus. 45 minutes for 2,20 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rome and love this hidden treasure in a great location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DKBNZTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: Its not flash, but. It's clean , rooms are ok, nice simple breakfast, lovely staff, and 5 mins walk to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. I have stayed there 4 times, by myself, with friends and family. I will be back. You feel safe, it's a quiet street, but soooo accessible. More than you need for a great stay in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: europa1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. Just a little tight. Perfect location. Breakfast was good and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nermacis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located quite close to Trevi Fountain and within walking distance of a number of attractions. The room was clean and comfortable. The mattress was a little on the soft side for my personal preference. Breakfast was adequate and the staff were pleasant. However I did find noise from the street, the room above, the corridor outside my room and the banging of doors a bit disturbing and I had requested a quiet room. If noise is a not a factor, this is an easy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy48
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel close to Trevi fountain and all attractions. Room very small like all Rome small hotels and B& B's. Good Breakfast and friendly staff. Arriving at 3am didn't phase the owner although he rushed us into our room was he was clearly tired. Querky little lift that takes only two people or your luggage but not both. Our opinion; thsi hotel is better than a standard Rome B&B

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affodable”
Reviews.Author: Josephine K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 14-17th December last year. the hotel is small but in a good location Rooms are clean. the staff were very good and kind.I remmber the Jovial Paola who kept encouraging my sister and I as we were waiting for our luggage to be delivered from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Is heat necessary in January? - YES!”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryStudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights in mid-January and ended up having to sleep in my coat. I returned very late the first night after an exhausting day in Rome and quickly fell asleep. An hour later I woke up shivering. I searched the room for a proper blanket (the bed only had a thin sheet) and the heating control, but found nothing. I put my coat on and curled up in a ball to keep warm. In the morning it was painful to shower and go from delicious warm water into an ice cold room. I went down to complain about the heat and was told that there is central heating in the hotel and that later in the day housekeeping would check the heat in my room. I received no apology, no mention of a reduction in the bill due to the absence of a basic necessity, but just a blank look. There were not enough chairs in the breakfast room so I had to bring up my food on a paper plate and eat in my freezing room. I returned that night and the room was slightly better on first inspection. I was able to sleep only using a heavy sweater, but when I woke up the room was cold again. I quickly dressed, breakfasted, and said good riddance to this hotel. I urge people not to stay in this place in winter. The lack of heat won’t be a problem in other seasons and perhaps the pungent smell of must that permeates the room and hallways subsides.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ColTownsville
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group of friends, we had 4 rooms, which ranged from tiny to a good size, same goes for the bathrooms, but we managed to cope with the inconvenience because of the location. On our return to Rome we had 3 rooms which were fine, although my sister and i ended up in the disabled room which was ok, but the bathroom had a very unplesant smell and the shower curtain and tiles were very mouldy, a good scrub is definately in order . we would use the hotel again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Julia”
Reviews.Author: willcock_ann
Reviews.Content: THis is not an hotel for anyone who wants just a little space for their suitcase. Only accept the largest room when you book and if that is not free then go somewhere else. Whilst the staff were friendly and tried hard it really is a classical rabbit warren and you fall over your bed to get in the door. Plumbing worse than average.Good position and maybe best for young backpackers with small packs!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. Rooms were sparsely decorated, but clean. Shower is very tiny. Breakfast is lovely in small dining room with standard faire of pastry, cheese, yogart fresh fruit and breads. Great value for location.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BR1AN_UK
Reviews.Content: Although the location and service was excellant overall I've given it 3 stars. I honestly think that your experience here is dependant on which room you get. On the plus side it is only a stroll away from Trevi Fountain and at the bottom of the street is a mini supermarket. Also the staff are so friendly and helpful that they made it a pleasent stay. The downside is that are paticular room had the smallest bathroom I have ever been in, the bedroom area was also tiny but at the end of the day it was cheap and only a place to sleep. I would only recommend it to back packers but if you go try and get a decent size room.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: anna186605
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel to be well located for romes sights.we stayed on second floor ,our room was sold to us as being a small queen room however the size wasnt a problem but the bathroom was ,there was a constant smell of sewerage, the shower only gave a dribble of cold water and you could barely turn around.in general the room was clean even though the decor was shabby.breakfast was ok .the staff in this hotel are very welcoming and helpful and should be regarded as one of its better assets.our stay for three nights cost euro 435

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little expensive..”
Reviews.Author: ChristineandBrendon
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The rooms were clean and very spacious. The staff were friendly enough and breakfast was fine. The location is excellent. But we did think for a 3 star hotel such as this, that the price was too high. We paid AUD$186 a night (about 135 Euro) which is too high. There was nothing overly special about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WienMa8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with really perfect location. 3 min. walking to Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location in Rome, less than 5 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and less than 10 from the Spanish Steps. The triple suite we stayed in was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The staff were very well informed and were able to give insightful information into the goings on of Rome. We would definitely go back and recommend to those trying to stay in Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “For the Money, Very Good”
Reviews.Author: BR1AN_UK
Reviews.Content: Rome is a very expensive place to stay so we booked this hotel because of its cheap price. Overall that in mind I would have to say it was a very nice Hotel. Pros: Great Location Staff so friendly Nice Buffet Continental Breakfast Looks great even had old style shutter lift Housekeeping brilliant Cons: Smallish sized rooms Walls a bit thin

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for college students traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: kjones90
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel was the location. Only a two minute walk to both the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain.I walked to all of the tourist attractions in Rome from the hotel. I was staying in the hotel alone and never felt unsafe, even when walking back at night. The rooms are a little small but I had a private with a bathroom and it had everything I needed. The breakfast was also a very nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: dorothy_tong
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be quite average...small sized room, but had a/c and a large bathroom for European standards. Breakfast was served in the morning, again nothing to write home about, but enough to get you through the morning. Front desk staff were not very helpful with directions or tips for travelling, but there are plenty of other ways to get advice in Rome. The location was what made it worth the price though. The hotel was only a 5-10min walk from the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona (which is magical at night) and close to the metro station as well. If you're on a budget, this is a pretty ideal place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great for Solo Travelers”
Reviews.Author: JAC617
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for me since i was traveling alone. It was also much nicer than some of the other hotels i stayed in while in Italy. The single room was very small but i really only slept there so i didn't mind just having a bed and shower (who goes to Rome and spends alot of time in their hotel room anyway). The room was clean and the shower while a bit small was bigger than other places i stayed. The location was AMAZING, everything is in walking distance (i like to walk to the 2-3 miles to the attractions were nothing to me). The location is by far the best thing about this place, but the hotel itself was nice. My room didn't have AC but as i went in early June it wasn't necessary at that time they did have a box fan in the room. The breakfast was great (i recommend taking an apple or piece of bread to stick in your bad to eat later in the day). I didn't notice lots of noise, my room had a window on to the street but its a very small not really busy street. I'm not sure I'd like this place if i was traveling with someone else but it was definitely great for a solo trip, and definitely worth every penny. Really great Budget hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely... wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: wayfaring-stranger99
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome, and I was not sure what to expect... I enjoyed it so much, I am already planning another trip. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. I had a single with a bathroom... small, but it was ok. You have to understand that this is not a posh, luxury hotel... it is on the older side, but I believe it is well worth it... It is located very close to the Trevi fountain and a block from the Palazzo Barberini. The breakfast was very nice... pastries and such, but fulfilling enough to get your morning started. I stepped out of the front door into a cobblestone alley surrounded by beautiful older buildings. Walked a bit, and there is a delicious restaurant Hostaria Romana. Several cafes near. The nearest metro is Barberini Fontana di Trevi (which is by the Palazzo Barberini), but I truly did not use it much since the city is so beautiful and it is worth walking everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Accomadatioms good, Staff HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Me_and_not_you
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was that it was a cute and quaint place and definitely Roman style which I was quite excited about. I arrived before check in time and although my reservation was already confirmed, the staff member at the front desk insisted that I provid her with my passport to hold my room-keep in mind that it was 9 am. She didn't suggest anything after that knowing I had just arrived. So I ask for tour information and went on with my day self guided! Basically the staff's assistance from there was not expected for 106 Euros a night. They were completely unhelpful when asked for assistance for anything. I once asked for a recommendation of a resturant and was given a small and rather tasty one but the staff there stated "we have given you more than enough time and we have ppl waiting to eat" of course thi isn't the hotels fault but the hotel staff response to knowing this was "well they are small and get busy so they can't have ppl there for a while" REALLY????? Anyhow, if you don't expect any kind of service and just intend to sleep (and eat breakfast) then stay here! It's truly in a prime location I just wished they were nicer. And since I was traveling alone, the help would have made my trip to Rome so much better! There were 2 other hotels on the same street that was probably similarly priced and more polite staff! Room description: Big (but lumpy) bed but if you're exhausted it's perfect! Bathroom is a good size - shower is TINY!! air conditioner- AWESOME!!!! Oooh one final complaint ... My flip flops were stolen from my room! I wore these only once to dinner about 1 hr of time and sure enough they were taken from my room!! I had a computer iPad etc etc and my flip flops were what was taken!!! This by all means states I had a bad time in Rome but I'm sure staying at a hotel with nicer staff would have made my first experience in Rome that much better! PLEASE KEEP LOOKING FOR ANOTHER HOTEL IN THIS LOCATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff, good "budget" hotel”
Reviews.Author: volosong
Reviews.Content: I was quite concerned about the negative reviews concerning this hotel. My experience was a pleasant one. All I wanted was a place to sleep. Who goes to Rome to spend a lot of time in their hotel room? The breakfast was adequate. Decent variety, plenty available; but the same "menu" the entire week I stayed there. It started getting "old" after a week. Still, quantity and variety was sufficient. Usually, I went down to eat breakfast when they first opened at 7:30. At that time, there was only me or one/two other couples in the dining room. One morning, due to staying out late, I didn't get down to breakfast until 8:30/9:00. I was surprised to see the dining room completely full and several people had to wait a few minutes for an available table. My room was one of the smaller rooms with the shower down the hall. It was quite small, but then again, I only went there to sleep. The bed was quite old, but very firm. I sleep well. The room and toilet/sink room was very clean. No complaints about the cleanliness of the room. The bracket holding the rod for hanging cloths broke right away and I reported it to the front desk, (taking a picture of the broken bracket with my camera to show them). This was on a Saturday evening. By Tuesday, the bracket was fixed. To me, with stores being closed on Sunday, that was pretty good service. Until the bracket was fixed, I just hung my slacks over the back of the chair and hung my shirts on the coat hooks attached to the wall. The shower room was very clean and the whole week I was in residence, I never saw anyone else use the shower room. The heat of the water was good. Hotter than what I needed. Some of the previous reviews mentioned the hotel being "noisy". Well . . . what would one expect from being in the middle of a very dense urban environment in a culture where being outdoors is a way of life. The room did not have air conditioning, (that I was aware of). I kept he window open the whole time and did hear a lot of noise. Romans tend to honk their car horns often, and people talk when walking. The lanes are narrow, so noise echoes easily. Still, it should be expected that noise will be something that will have to be endured due to the location. After walking about town all day, even with the noise and hard bed, I still slept soundly. The staff were all first-rate! All speak English quite well, even if a couple were self-conscious about their abilities. The only staff member who I wasn't sure spoke English was the young lady who brought food out to the breakfast table and cleared the dishes after people left. Only reason I don't know if she spoke English is that I tried to communicate in Italian as much as possible and the occasion did not occur where I spoke to her in English. The front desk staff were quite fluent, and even helped me learn a few Italian phrases. I rented a bicycle for several days, (great way to see Rome, if you are not timid about the traffic). I was not allowed to keep the bicycle in my room, (safety reasons), and the staff let me keep the bicycle in a secure location in the back rooms until I retrieved it the second day. They were very helpful in helping me select a cycling route to visit a few of the places I wanted to travel by bicycle to, (Ostia Antica and Via Appia Antica). The front desk staff was also very helpful in obtaining information about opening and closing times of various venues I wanted to visit. They have a internet connected computer at the front desk and are more than willing to look up something for you. (I understand that the hotel provides wireless connectivity, but I did not have an occasion to utilize it. I think they have a small cubby with a computer available to guests, but again, I was not in Rome to web surf.) Bottom line...fantastic location, (about three blocks from Trevi), very helpful staff, clean rooms, a breakfast to keep you going all day ... but don't expect luxury. I would not hesitate to stay again at Hotel Julia on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “More like hostel accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: meghan365
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had booked based on the Trip Advisor Reviews. When we arrived we were disappointed, the hotel itself reminded me more of a hostel, and though it was a private room with a private bath, the room was very small and pretty run down. We didn't like it, and they unfortunately had no other rooms available. We walked around to other hotels in the area and found the recently renovated Hotel Ango-Americano (which had horrible reviews on trip advisor) and to our surprise, they showed us a GORGEOUS, recently renovated room for only 15 Euros more per night than the Hotel Julia. We had a wonderful stay there and I could not recommend it more highly. I will say the Hotel Julia is in a fantastic location, and the people were gracious about our cancelling the reservation (still was billed for one night, but that was fair as we didn't decide to change till 8PM), but I wouldn't recommend it, would instead highly recommend Hotel Ango Americano down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rougette63
Reviews.Content: Being a woman and a first time solo traveller to Rome, I was looking for a place that was within walking to the major attractions of the city, well this quaint little hotel was THE most perfect place!!! You are 5 minutes from the Trevi Fountains, 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps, walking distance to Termani train station and there are restaurants and shops just a hop skip and jump from the hotel. If you are looking for a luxury in a posh hotel, don't go there but if you are looking for a comfortable, clean place to rest your body after hours of walking the streets of Rome, you have gone to the right place. The hotel offers a breakfast and has wireless internet also. The staff is extremely kind and helpful in suggesting place to visit, where to eat and how to get around the city. I am returning to Rome and I will definetly stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Olga98
Reviews.Content: Hotle Julia is a very nice hotel, especially for the independent traveller. The rooms are very clean & warm with fresh linen and bathroom supplies every day. Has an excellent staff, very helpful & friendly. The location is excellent as well, only a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. It is a minute to the Piazza Barberini metro station. I admit that me & my friends we really enjoyed our stay there and we will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean, and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug091011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Julia for 1 week in early October. As a solo female traveler, I appreciated Hotel Julia's central and safe location. I easily walked to most sites, but was grateful that the Barberini Metro stop was only 5 minutes away when it rained. The Single Economic Room was fairly priced and clean. My room was in the back of the hotel, and very quiet and comfortable. I did not have any problems sharing a shower down the hall. The shower was hot and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel Julia offers free wi-fi, but you can only access it in the lobby. After traveling throughout Italy for 3 weeks and staying in budget hotels, I thought that Hotel Julia had one of the most generous hotel breakfasts, e.g., hardboiled eggs, pastries, rolls, cheeses, ham, yogurt, cereals, fruit, tea, coffee drinks, and juices. For a solo traveler, Hotel Julia is an excellent budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mystichill
Reviews.Content: This is not a 3 star hotel. I would have to give it 2 stars. The breakfast was average. The only thing good about this hotel is the location. Very noisy outside.

Reviews.Title: “worthy little hotel with great position”
Reviews.Author: alssio
Reviews.Content: this hotel is basic but nothing important is missing. I chose it for the price and above all for the position that is absolutely great. In 2 min walking you can reach the underground and move to others sites of the town is very easy. Staff is very helpfull and friendly. I definetly would come back to it.

Reviews.Title: “A very good find - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paulvew
Reviews.Content: The single rooms without lavatories are excellent value even though the price has now gone up from EUR 50 to 60 (adequate) breakfast included. Excellent location, quiet street, simple, pleasant. The double room for EUR 120 with lavatory was spacious and attractive. But pools of water did appear on my floor mysteriously.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location”
Reviews.Author: ormika
Reviews.Content: we have to admit, that Rome is not cheap if we talk about accommodation. The location of this hotel is excellent. You can really visit the historic centre of Rome on foot. This is what you pay for and not for the services of the hotel. The room I had, was a double room with 2 single beds, but as the room was narrow... no chance to make one big bed. The bedding was not changed at all (I spent 5 nights there). I hope the reason is that they think of the planet... The breakfast is ok (eventhough I agree with other travellers - dry bread rolls). There is cereal, fruit, cheese, cold cuts, pastry. If you are not looking for a fancy hotel, you don't want to have the sheets changed everyday... this hotel is can be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great location”
Reviews.Author: GregandTricia
Reviews.Content: In line with the other reviews I guess; quiet narrow street; just around the corner from some top spots; staff very good; breakfast plain but lots of it; has a lift; wireless in foyer; fair value for Italian 3 star (don't expect bright, new, flashy).

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMontreal
Reviews.Content: The bed was cleen but NOT THE ROOM. I made my reservation five months in advance and 24H before I arrive they sent me e-mail saying my creditcard number was wrong so they could not confirm my reservation!!! They did not check for more then 5 months? I send my credit card number again and when I arrive, the man gave me a room without toilet even if my reservation was with a toilet at least I could change rooms.The furniture is more than old and the room is very little. the only good thing about this place is the location Maybe the double room are better but not single one

Reviews.Title: “All we really needed”
Reviews.Author: Miltonboy101
Reviews.Content: After two nights in the over-priced Hotel Fontana we switched to the Julia. Although not the location of Fontana we felt it was much better. A mere 200 metres from the Trevi Fountain it was reasonable, clean and very helpful staff. When in Rome you really only need a place to rest your head but it's nice when the necessities are there. Free breakfast, an AC that worked and the staff let us use the hotel computer to order tickets etc. Short walks to restauants, shopping, Metro etc it was simple yet complete.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: traveler00912
Reviews.Content: this is by far the worst hotel I have ever been in, the breakfast was absoloutly terrible, no warm foods, coffee was cold same goes with tea, the rooms had mold all over the walls as you can see by some of the pictures others have posted. the TV was probably 6 inches wide and had 1 English channel. the housekeeping was only their for the morning so if you left your room after 9 your beds and sheets would not be made until the next date. the price was absolutely ridiculous and generally an all around 1 star motel or guest house, not 3 star by any international standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, more than lived up to expectations, I've already booked it for my next trip”
Reviews.Author: Isabel_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel says it’s located on a quiet street and it really is, from either direction when your turn down this street, Via Rasella, it is noticeably quieter. The hotel is in a couple of old palazzos, next to each other. The “Domus Julia”, where we stayed the first two nights, has several floors of ‘suites’ consisting of a common area and three rooms. So if you are traveling with a group you could book the whole thing. It was newly renovated, very clean, quiet, room and bathroom were both huge. There was satellite TV and a mini-fridge (which was not exactly cold, cooler than room temp though). Internet does not reach the Domus so you have to go to the breakfast room in the main hotel next door for wi-fi. When we returned to Rome we stayed another three nights, this time in the main hotel. Room was a little smaller (but still fairly large) but internet worked in the room. I actually preferred it over the Domus Julia which is considered better. Extremely friendly staff. The breakfast was very good – coffee or tea, juice, yogurt, cereals, cheeses, hams, rolls and croissants, etc. The usual buffet style and everything was good. It’s a 2 block walk to Piazza Barbarini (which has a metro stop) where there were several inexpensive restaurants. We really like Soby’s which is a pizzeria and a tavola calda (meats, pasta, veggies, fish, kebabs) with very well air conditioned dining room.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN ALL OF ITALY”
Reviews.Author: Arash-GTR
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel me or my family has ever stayed in. From the first minute i walked into the hotel I realized what a horrible mistake I had made, and to add insult to injury we paid over 2200 Euros for 2 rooms for a 10 day stay, that’s roughly 120 Euros per room. Firstly the hotel is not a 3 star hotel by any international or even Italian standards; at best it is a 1.5 star. The breakfast was terrible, very few choices of dry bread from the day before. The utensils were all plastic, including plates. The hot water machine was turned off 1 hour before breakfast finished and we had to drink cold tea and coffe. No fruits, no service at all from breakfast. The room it self was another atrocity. The sheets were changed every 4days or so and had dog hair all over them... we asked the hotel to change this but it turns out their is no maids on service in the hotel in the afternoons, their is basically 1 person running the entire hotel from reception on. The towels were changed every 3 days and had hairs on them. The 9 inch tv has 5 channels all Italian except for BBC news. the hotel had free wifi but it only served the lower floors, if u were on a higher floor such as the 3rd or 4th you would not get a connection The rooms was rarely cleaned and had mold all over the walls inside the actual room, roof and washroom which you can see from the pictures I have posted up. We contacted the Italian health department but have yet to receive feedback from them. All in all the worst hotel I have ever stayed in my whole life. They are lucky to even get a 1.5 star rating from me. Check the pictures and stay far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value”
Reviews.Author: Mondave
Reviews.Content: Great location. Ok breakfast. Service helpful and friendly. Air cond but you have to ask for the remote. Good value. Noisy street so you have to close shutters at night. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously consider looking ELSEWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: jillmet
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Europe and stayed at the Hotel Julia for two nights. All that it really has going for itself is the location. It is about 10 minutes walk to Trevi fountain and 5 minutes walk to the metro. But really, there is not much else going for it. The bed was springs and sheets- hard to sleep well with springs in your back. At 120Euro a night I expect a comfortable bed... at least! While the room we stayed in was large it could be much more well maintained. The floor appears to have recently been redone with a plastic hardwood-looking material- which really goes to tell you how much they value quality.... The shower was tiny and not very clean. The breakfast was sub-par for a city with endless bakeries and cafes. We ate breakfast elsewhere- can't waste any meals when you are in a city of such fabulous food and drink! The wireless internet is extremely slow and has a poor connection... had to sit in one spot in the room (by the door) to get a decent signal! There are MANY hotels in the area which were much more attractive, clean and comfortable- so.... seriously do consider looking elsewhere to spend your money! Hotel Julia should be your last resort!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Faldi
Reviews.Content: Good position, the Hotel is OK and the price is good.

Reviews.Title: “I've never switched hotels faster!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl1812
Reviews.Content: A very nice staff only makes up for so much. This poor little hotel is a disaster. It provides only the most basic of needs. The bathrooms are tiny and moldy, the hallways are a bit creepy, the beds are hard and the whole thing is unclean. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: MaryG_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was recommended by a personal friend. It cost 5 Euros less per night than a rented apartment in the student ghetto I also stayed in on the other side of town, and was 100X better. Walking distance to the Trevi fountain. As a young woman travelling alone, I felt the area was safe enough to walk in at night. Barberini subway is just around the corner, and the staff speak good English. The night guy was kinda useless. I asked him where to get good food, and he said he didn't know and told me to go explore. I did, and had pizza that tasted like paper. When I came back, he asked me what I found, and I told him, and he said "I could've told you that place sucked." Well....why didnt' you before I ate there?! Despite that, I would recommended it because the rest of the staff is great. I asked them to book a tour to Pompeii for me, and they booked it while I was out during the day and the forms were ready for me when I got back. This is one of those hotels that keep your room key while you leave. You are not allowed to take it with you. internet was cheap but it cut out a few times while I was using it. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: dramamama7388
Reviews.Content: Others have said this, and I will say it again, this hotel is all about location, location, location. As a young female American traveling to Rome alone, it was essential for me to find a hotel that I felt comfortable at. The Hotel Julia definitely met my criteria. Everything was very easily walkable for me. I walked from the hotel to the Vatican in under an hour. I walked all around town for about a week and never felt like I was too far from anything. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, even the Colosseum was easily reached. The hotel staff was also amazing. I never found that I had language barriers, or that the front desk staff was rude in the slightest. I had even caught a little bug one day of my trip, and the woman at the front desk was kind enough to reschedule my tour that I had planned for the day. She even called back a few hours later to ask how I was feeling and to see if I needed anything. That all being said, I can tell you that the accommodations are definitely all on the small scale. I booked a single room with my own bathroom and it was TINY. I will post a picture, and as you can see it is most certainly a single room. Not much room for anything at all. My drain ran slow, and the toilets took me a minute or two to figure out, but honestly not too terrible. For me the hotel was perfect. I don't travel abroad to stay in fancy suites, so being able to be so close to so many attractions in Rome was perfect. It was in a safe neighborhood and I never felt overly worried about my safety. Overall, if you are looking for a decently cheap hotel right in the city center and don't mind sacrificing on space, Hotel Julia is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Basic Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RScharfer9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Julia several years ago, and booked a superior double room for 3 nights. We did not realize the superior doubles are now located in Domus Julia, an adjacent older building, with a separate entrance, next door. The main hotel has a cute little typical small hotel entrance. The Domus Julia has a separate entrance leading into a dark hallway. We requested to change to a standard double in the hotel, and were accomodated. The rooms are small, but adequate for a short stay. (The standard room was not that much smaller than the superior room.) The shower, although small was excellent - great water pressure. The location is excellent, near Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, bus and metro transportation. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast, although not great is more than adequate. The price, 120 to 130 euros a night, is very reasonble for a solid 3 star hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: philmonthow
Reviews.Content: As others have noted you can't find a better location -- 10 minutes from the Trevi, two from the fabulous Barberini Museum, 15 from the Via Veneto. Contrary to one of the previous reviews, the breakfast is generous. Yes, the cheese is prepackaged but it's tasty, not Velveeta. The cold cuts were wonderful. There was a wide assortment of rolls, dry and sweet, several mornings an apricot tart. The offerings were frequently replenished. You can ask, as I did, for cafe latte or capuccino, and the friendly staff brings it to you. The room was plain, but the bed comfortable. To use wi-fi in the room all you have to do is ask the helpful staff for a code you type in every time you go on line. I did not inspect the carpet as carefully as the reviewer from Budapest but the room was clean. The streets seemed entirely safe, and it is a two-minute walk from Colline Emiliane, one of the best restaurants in Rome. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: chatzie
Reviews.Content: The "double" bed is just two single beds shoved together. Too expensive for hostel like quality. Food is sub-par, no internet, tv didn't work, flies everywhere, unhelpful staff. Good location though, and it had a shuttle from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It is still worth the money”
Reviews.Author: leekinboo
Reviews.Content: Location is great. The staff I met is not so good at explain, but that could be a problem of the Language. There is only WiFi in the lobby and normally you don't get any signal in your room, I am on the second floor. The breakfast has no quality, you can barely take some coffee and juice. I booked the single room without bathroom, that is okay for a solo traveler like me . Comparing the price,cleanness and location , i will still recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated bath, and great location”
Reviews.Author: missingitalia10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights last week. I would recommend but here are the cons: the nearby street via tritone wasn't the best to walk around, but there is a cute way to walk to the trevi fountain on a less crowded street. The service can be spotty. Some people were very helpful and others not so much. For example. the morning we were leaving, we were waiting for our car at 6:30am in the lobby. The car arranged by the hotel was running late, and the man who worked there wasn't being very nice. For example, he didn't even say anything as we were leaving. He only responded "bon viaggo" after we said grazie and arrivederci. It was a little stand offish. Also, the whole breakfast was set up in the next room and we weren't offered anything as we waited. We had a room on the street which was great because it had gorgeous windows that you could open to look out and and let in a breeze. You can also yell Bon Giorno Tutti! if you wish. Overall the rooms were very clean, bathrooms were updated, and most of the staff were helpful. You can easily walk to spanish steps, trevi fountain, piazza navona, and even the vatican from this hotel. It is a great value and it was wonderful to walk by the trevi fountain a few times every day. The restaurant down the street, il chianti was fabulous!!! Have a wonderful trip. The shower was very hot too!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: emy77emy
Reviews.Content: Sooooo....... step by step: Location: great - central, 4 min to metro station barberini, 10 min to Trevi fountain, 10 min to Spain Plazza, Vila Medici & Vila Borghese - 15 min Breakfast: horrible, awfull, unbelievable low - cheese - some kind of supermarket prepacked awfull type; meat - some choped pieces of the lowest kind, really unexpected low quality Room: small, you have to jump over the bed to pass on the other side of the room; TV - only Rai Uno Bathroom: large, well equiped Cleanliness: very clean Staff: nice Conclusions: we paid 85 euros/ night. Guess what: not worth it. I stayed better in hostels in Amsterdam & Lucern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mickeygott
Reviews.Content: Old story location, location, location. A 5 minute walk from Pizza Barberini, Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes Spanish Steps, Pantheon etc. Rooms small but clean, little noisy but not obtrusive. Friendly helpful staff. Considering price and location great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: BrightonAngel
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I took a chance on this hotel. The location was perfect for us as we could walk to all the main sights. We even walked to the Vatican taking about 40 minutes; I chose a route through some very amazing streets. Don’t forget the national art gallery just at the end of the road. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, however we heard one argument at the check in desk but the guest was in the wrong making a totally un-realistic request, embarrassing. The hotel has many creative and character-full touches and was reasonably clean. My only criticism was the noise factor, not so much the outside road (remember this is a busy city), but other guests. Ok the walls are thin but why are people so utterly oblivious to the noise they make, slamming doors, shouting down the corridor to friends three rooms away, phone calls back home (again they shout because it’s a long way!?) and putting on TV’s at 3am full blast. Rant over, give it a try but check which accommodation you booked and are being put into the hotel or the B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tmg81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Julia was recommended by our parents and that made me a bit nervous at the start. When we arrived I was so grateful. Everyone says the Trastavere district is a great spot but this really can't be beat. You're only minutes walk from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and right on the open air bus route. There is a great pizza spot at the end of the street just to grab a bite. Definitely ask for a room in the back if it's available. Like anywhere in Rome things can get a little noisy if you're close to the street. The bathroom was also another added bonus - huge by European standards. To top it all off it was a really great rate for the location and room size.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: PatrycjaBrussels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there on my first trip to Rome and I've chose it because of the location (2-3 minutes to metro, 3-5 minutes to fontanna de Trevi, about 10 minutes walk to Spanish Steps). Staff was quite friendly, but the room! Room was dusty ans smelling strange, with outstretched arms I could nearly touch both walls so the room was not more than 2 meters wide, but was long , (part of the space near window was used for bathroom so the room was very dark. Bathroom was very little but clean with towels and hairdryer. I had shared shower where was no hot water, although I have complained nothing was done during my 3 day stay (I had to use shower on the other floor) Bed was really hard so I couldn't sleep. Walls there are thin co I could hear very well conversation of my neighbours. Breakfast : bread rolls and pastry which seemed to be made at least day before, some kind of ham and cheese, jam and poor coffee. There are many hotels in Rome so it wouldn't be wise to stay in Julia ….

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Old_Gregg_9
Reviews.Content: The Good: Good location, staff very friendly. Room pretty nice. Bathroom pretty nice also. Free wi-fi although see below... The Bad: Wi-fi is possibly the worst i've ever had. Drops out & forces you to sign back in every 10 mins or so or when you are half way through a credit card confirmation, whichever comes first. Bring ear plugs!! walls seem to be very thin so noise from neighbours, and for my room, noise from street, until late and then starting again early (during the week that is). Double room was 105e including breakfast. Breakfast not bad, cereal, juice, pastries/sweet croissants, bread rolls, jam etc. No fruit though :( Overall, not recommended. Rome may be expensive, but I don't think this place was worth it, especially when compared to Hotel Cavour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but . . .”
Reviews.Author: AgingTravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Rome allowing you to walk to all of the main attractions. Beyond its location however, we were not impressed with the hotel. All hotels in Rome are expensive, but we selected the Julia because previous reviews had generally good comments Believe previous reviews about the really bad breakfast. It is the same thing day after day after day. Stale bread, plain yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, thinly sliced meat, and prunes. Sunday they put out fresh peaches - that was the only deviation. Air conditioning worked, but it would either be hot or cold during the night. If you have a room facing the street, expect noise beginning around 5 am.

Reviews.Title: “Not a grea hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonTaraLondon
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. It has tiny rooms and very thin walls -- you can hear everything in the next room and the corridor. At breakfast you have to stand in line for a long time to be seated - they do not have enough tables in the small breakfast room. The service at breakfast is very poor -- they don't restock the trays for ages, so you would be waiting for your cheese or juice for half an hour! It is a very poor selection at breakfast too. The only good thing about this hotel is the location but it is far too expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Stevens281
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in Jan 09. As all the reviews say, which is why I chose the place, is the location. A 2 min walk from the Trevi Fountain, maybe 3 min walk to the Metro stop, and 15 Min walk to the Colloseum and all that surrounds it. The room and bathroom was pretty clean, wasnt a 4 or 5 star by any means, and the breakast was ok. The staff was friendly. Like all the Hotels I stayed in over there, it was a little noisy at night, I wore earplugs, and it was ok then. They have free wireless in the lobby, but mine worked in my room, so that was a bonus. Id stay here again mainly cause it was a decent price and the location couldnt be beat. I ventured all over Rome by myself, and it all seemed pretty safe, the area where this Hotel is, is always full of people walking the streets, and I was never concerened.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: shoppergal
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was fine. It wasn't the worst hotel I've ever stayed in but it certainly was nowhere near the best. Pros: Location-this is probably the best feature of the hotel. It is so central, only got the metro once and other than that walked everywhere. Clean-hotel room was spotless Shower-was really powerful. Cons: The noise-this for me was the biggest factor. The hotel room was stifling hot(in January!!) and the radiator couldn't be turned off so we had no choice but to have the window a little open(it didn't close properly anyway so we couldn't have closed it). From 7.30 every morning the noise outside was crazy. I realise the outside noise was outside the hotels control but when we asked about changing to a different room they moved to us to the exact same room a floor up!!! Had lost the will to fight it at this stage and the second room wasn't so hot so we could leave the window closed. The staff- I have to say that the staff at the hotel were quite abrupt, they were never rude but just not friendly at all. I asked the first night about where the nearest internet cafe was and was told that there was a computer available for guests use. Great perk which I really appreciated. I was waiting on an urgent e-mail so once each day asked if I could use the internet and each time felt like I was bothering them. By the 4th day of my stay I felt so uncomfortable asking that I just found an internet cafe instead. Breakfast- practically non-existant. Croissants, corn flakes and some juice might be left if you were lucky. Not a major issue but certainly not a selling point of the hotel. Overall, the hotel was fine and you get what you pay for but next time I travel to Rome I would sooner pay a little extra for something that bit "nicer"

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: pacebene
Reviews.Content: Hotel Julia is in a great location. It is close to the metro, buses and favorite sights but it is on a side street (quiet). I only needed to stay one night. I was able to throw my bags down after traveling from a 7 day stay in Assisi. I booked the hotel knowing that I wanted to make it to the Spainish Steps to see the Pope for the Immaculate Conception and on a budget. The front desk was helpful, offering a map of Rome and a bottle of water.. The Spainsih Steps were just a few blocks away, alowing me to walk & be part of this event. In addition, I had plans to meet friends at Piazza Navona for dinner later in the evening. I returned to the hotel to refresh and then headed out again for a short, lively walk to the Trevi Fountain & then Piazza Navona. I opted to take a taxi the short ride back to the hotel after dinner wich only cost me 6 euro. The room wasn't the prettiest or most comfortable but it served my purpose. I also booked knowing breakfast was included. When I woke early (6:30) the front desk offered me cofee but no breakfast because I was too early?? They did arrange a taxi to get me to the airport which arrived on time @ 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chariot
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - very close to Trevi fountain/Spanish Steps/metro etc. The rooms were clean and tidy and had a security box. Our rooms faced onto the road and so were quite noisy. You could also hear people in other rooms, albeit not loudly. Our shower head was slightly loose so the water trickled out. For the price and location you could not do better.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. place”
Reviews.Author: tseanes
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean. Breakfast mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible mattress”
Reviews.Author: travelingNerds
Reviews.Content: The location is really good - about 5 minutes to the Trevi fountain and lots of nice restaurants. There is no need to book a tourist bus tour because all the major sights are in walking distance (Colosseum, Vatican 15-20 minutes) If you book this hotel make sure that you ask for a quiet room. A friend of mine arrived before us and got a really noisy room. When we checked in we requested a quiet room. We were lucky that we got one because they told us that we should have requested a quiet room when we booked. The mattress in our bed was really, really terrible, so if you have back problems that might not be the right place for you. Not all rooms have A/C, so make sure you request a room with A/C when you book. The staff were very polite and helpful. The price in September was really high (170 Eur/night), but they occasionally have weekend offers. You have to email them to get these offers. We also noticed that the Domus Julia (a B&B which belongs to the hotel) is a bit cheaper and it's right next door. It's worth sending an email to ask for the price of both the hotel and the B&B. We received replies to our emails withing 12 hours and with the special offer paid about 120Eur/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & clean - that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: Kneedown
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Hotel Julia in August at the start of the three week trip around Italy. The location was great, it was clean & quiet and that is all there is to rave about. The location was fantastic. 5mins walk to the Trevi, Via Del Corso, Spanish Steps. Piazza Venizia and other sites are not very much further. Plenty of food, shopping, transport & conveniences around the corner. The room was tiny with a tiny window overlooking a back street. The bathroom was functional and clean like the room. No fridge however there was a barely functioning airconditioner. Bed was small and uncomfortable. The room was quiet apart from some repeated door banging early one morning. The breakfast was terrible! While all hotels in Italy only do continental style breakfast, this was by far the worst we had. The breadrolls were disgusting and looked like an insect nest inside! (affectionately known thereafter as 'insect bread'), some lousy ham, plastic cheese, sour yoghurt and dishwater coffee. Ham, cheese & coffee are impossible screw up in Italy!!!! We rarely spent any time in the room but made full use of the convenient location but not much else. Staff were reasonably friendly but not very helpful with information. They did not even know that there is a laundromat/internet point in the next street over. My advice would be to skip breakfast, enjoy the location but try to get the best deal possible as you do not get much for your money apart from location. We paid €88/night mid August but refused to pay €135/night when we tried to book a night in September on our way out. Rome is a complete rip off at every instance so I would be hard pressed to suggest an alternative really. I read the reviews but was not quite ready for how far below average it was.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyOf5
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, which is what you pay for. It is walking distance from nearly everything but the Vatican and the Coliseum, which can be easily reached via the subway. The rooms are very basic and the breakfast left a lot to be desired. However, it was quiet, comfortable and a good value if you are not planning on spending a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “short stay but seemed great”
Reviews.Author: j3dnight
Reviews.Content: I only got to stay one night here, had a single room but it would have done nicely if I was here more nights. Location is good, close to the sights, (spanish steps etc.) Did hear some street noise but it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: john6812
Reviews.Content: When booking the hotel we gave name & age of the chlidren & we were quoted a price on this basis. When we arrived the rooms were not suitable for the numbere of people so we had to move to a larger room, they charged extra. I feel this was done just to get us to the hotel. I would not stay there again, this is dishonesty.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: h2ofall2
Reviews.Content: It is not a great hotel, but we have stayed there twice, and have always found the staff very helpful. In all the 2 and 3 star hotels that we have stayed in their breakfast compares with everyone elses. Not great but it gets you going. Our room was comfortable, not very small, but what we have come to expect in this size of hotel. Its location is excellent and well within walking distance of all the major and alot of minor sights. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, and tried to assist us with any of our requests. I would recommend this hotel to my friends that don't expect 5 star service at a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: letsgotravel66
Reviews.Content: just back from 4 day stay from this great little hotel. Had read reviews and was somewhat cautious of what to expect but glad we had booked it. Great location, very central to all the major attractions - only a couple of minutes walk from Trevi fountain and 5 mins from Spanish Steps. It is located on a quiet street so no major noise at night. Staff were really helpful and geat for providing information. Rooms are basic and there were no tea/coffee facilities in room - but you could get a cup from reception, and for Rome - good value for money. It is a great little find right in centre and I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay for my 40th”
Reviews.Author: fish_28
Reviews.Content: Eight of us in total visited Rome and stayed at Hotel Julia this Easter for my 40th. Very friendly staff, clean hotel and cheap beer (unusual for Rome) even if only in cans. Rooms were compact, but we've stayed in smaller in Italy. Prices were extremely reasonable, especially when compared to other hotels in this super central area close to loads of things to see and some lovely restaurants. Buffet breakfast was fine, mostly bread, meat, croisants and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: daphnaHaifa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for the 3rd time this month, because of the great location, good breakfast, the friendly staff, and I wish to mention especially Rosa, with her I could talk about the city, history and museums. She is always happy to give a good advise and information. Dr. Daphna Sharfman Haifa,Israel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chloe099
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for a long weekend on 14 March 2008 We stayed at Hotel Julia which was only a five minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. The location was first-class. It was near all the major attractions. The hotel is a small and friendly. The room was clean and the underfloor heating was excellent (it was never switched off!). The breakfast was the usual continental breakfast of rolls, pastries, croissants, cereal, fruit juices and coffee. There was plenty to eat and the service was first class. The lady who works in the restaurant worked really hard and was extremely friendly and helpful to everyone. The only one problem was at times there were not enough tables so we had to wait for 10 minutes one morning, but this was no problem. There was a free safety deposit box in the room. Rome is a magnificent city and easy to walk from one attraction to another. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops for all tastes. Our bag was stolen from the railway station on our way home. We reported it to the police at the station who were extremely helpful. So keep your eye on your belongings at all times. We cant wait to return to Rome and we will definately stay at Hotel Julia again. Reviewer - Sharon from England.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: RoseWorthing
Reviews.Content: Great location, good room and the hotel was very clean. Good value for money as in a city. The buffet breakfast was really excellent. We were however disappointed with the reception staff who were not very courteous and could have been a lot more helpful,especially when we were ill and needed assistance.

Reviews.Title: “At Least You Don't Spend a Lot of Time in Your Room”
Reviews.Author: cwatsonk
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be charming as we approached the building. It stopped at the front desk. We loved Rosa who was extremely helpful! The room was cramped, the bath even more so. The beds were hard and narrow (not standard twin size). There is a lot of noise on the street outside, but it didn't last long and never kept us awake. High ceilings and vinyl floors. And a tiny bath. A tiny, tiny bath.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmkjmk
Reviews.Content: This was not the worst place we have ever stayed, but it definitely is not (as they claim) a 3 star hotel - even by inflated Rome standards. The small room and tiny bathroom were, perhaps, to be expected, and perhaps so was the incredibly loud noise that came all night from what initially looked like a seldom used street. However, twice we saw dirt marks on the sheets of the newly made bed (which were easy to notice, since they never put the bedspread back on the bed). A sense of the ambiance of the room can be gained from the fact that the only decoration on the main wall was a framed page giving the check out time. The breakfast was meager and tasteless. Most annoyingly, it is the only hotel I can remember where there was no Kleenex in the room - a noticeable omission since we both caught colds during our stay. On top of all this, when we arrived we were told that the advertised shuttle service to the airport did not operate early enough to get us to our 9:30 a.m. flight. We asked the desk to call a cab, but instead were met by some type of van that charged a flat rate that was 25% more than the typical airport cab fare quoted in guidebooks. After 3 weeks (and 10 hotels) in Italy, the Julia was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Well run family hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelcassidy2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and the hotel is situated in a great position just five minutes from the Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes from the Spanish Steps and just around the corner from the underground. On the underground, it was only 4 stops to the Vatican and only 4 stops to the Colisseum and only 40 minutes from the airport. The staff were helpful, spoke good English and were overall very pleasant. Breakfast was fine with the usual coffee, tea, orange juice, cornflakes, yoghurt, rolls, cheese, ham and croissants. The room was adequate with en-suite toilet and shower. Overall, an excellent place to stay and well worth the money. If we returned to Rome would we stay here again - you bet. Michael Cassidy Bicester Oxon

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJohnPaul
Reviews.Content: location is very good, but breakfast was salami and soft "crispy" rolls water-down orange boring food, avoid room 105 asked to move short middle aged manager said NO all full, next day asked nice lady (no problem goto 205) at the front street noise + inside noise, sums up this Hotel In Rome 4 star is our 3. you get what U pay for, summer time visit air-con room is compulsory !!! North Rome is best area to stay not this place . U have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “and let them relax.........”
Reviews.Author: BigJaydog
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Great location with a clean and comfortable room. Maybe a little small but besides that it's 100 of cement.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Hotel Julia !”
Reviews.Author: WeAreTravelingAgain
Reviews.Content: We do NOT recommend Hotel Julia. We were there for 5 nights at 170 Euros per night. Our room was in the annex and we had to unlock three doors, go down a long hallway, go up an elevator, and through another room before we got to our room. Don't dare forget anything - getting to your room is an event! The bed was VERY hard and low to the floor. After the first night, we asked for more blankets and put them all under the bottom sheet. (Even my husband, who likes a hard mattress, had a sore back.) The bathroom was clean but smelled of mildue. Taking a shower was an adventure. The shower head was centered on the long wall over the tub, and the shower curtain was 5 feet wide. It was impossible not to get some water on the floor - perhaps that explains the mildue smell. Breakfast was awful. Corn flakes, rolls, limberger cheese, salami, hard boiled eggs (overcooked - the yokes were really green), and a packaged cherry tart. The second way was the same with obviously left-over rools that crumbled in our hands, stale tart. After two days of this, the salami was replaced with baloney that had dime sized chunks of fat. I've never seen anything like it. We started to pop out the fat, then gave up and went to McDonald's. We, and others, had to wait for tables to be cleared and the staff was sullen. Internet access was being 'repaired' the 5 days we were there, and there are NO English television stations - not even CNN. Hotel Julia is a 2 star hotel at a 3 star price. We do NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LangerAbroad
Reviews.Content: Okey, the Julia was a fine hotel, the location was ideal and the rooms were compact but had aircon which is essential if you're staying in Rome during the summer. The hotel was ok but had a lot of problems, the breakfast wasnt great and the staff could be very hit and miss, ranging from friendly to surly. My biggest complaint was that we found ants in our room, which just isnt good enough. Again, the location was wonderful, within walking distance of everything but for me the negatives outweigh the positives and I certainly wont be staying at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Dont hesitate to book here!”
Reviews.Author: PeteShropshire
Reviews.Content: If your a Brit - view it as a standard, no frills hotel.If your from the States you will find the rooms very small. But it has everything you need-clean & private facilities. Breakfast is reasonable- simple continental & typical Italian. Location is fantastic - Metro 5 mins walk & then 4 stops to Vatican City for 1 euro & same in other direction to the colosium.From Hotel walk down Street, turn right 10mins to Spanish steps or straight over & 5 min stroll to the Trevi & 5 mins to Panatheon. Plenty of restaurants nearby - best ones are up the side streets off the main drag towards the Trevi & ice creame to die for. Hotel a bit pricy - but hey Rome is expensive anyway & if youre only staying 2/3 days the location is ideal so as not to waste any precious time getting to the sights. This is the second time weve stopped at Julia & it wont be the last. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: isicastle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, quiet street near the Trevi Fountain and the Metro. Lots of great restaurants around. Safe to walk around even at night. Stayed 3 times during our stay in Italy and got three different rooms. The first was a double room, which was not that big but comfortable. The second time we had a triple room with one double bed and a twin. The third time the room had a queen size bed and the room was much bigger. The bathroom in the three rooms was similar, recently remodeled bathrooms clean and comfortable. The breakfast was simple but good, included in the price of the room. The staff was good and friendly, all spoke English. All the hotels in the area are much more expensive, so this was a great deal. Will stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, particularly good location”
Reviews.Author: ChocFrog75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Julia several times when travelling to Rome on business. It's wonderfully located, just a stone's throw from the main city attractions and from the metro station. There are also a couple of wonderful restaurants only a few minutes away, which have made my stay more enjoyable. However, the hotel is extremely basic. A couple of times I was assigned bedrooms that -although the hotel is now completely no smoking - still reeked of cigarettes. Those rooms could do with some fresh paint and re-upholstering of the fittings. Breakfast is OK. This hotel is very good value by Rome standards, but don't expect any treats!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Would Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl16
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all-around good. Although the room was a bit small, it was clean and definitely adequate. The breakfast was good - cereals, crossiants, some meats and cheeses for sandwiches, hard boiled eggs, juices, and coffees. The staff, particularly the gentleman who worked the afternoons/evenings, was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel was in a good location and less than 5 minutes walking distance from the Barbarini Met.Ro stop. Would definitely recommend for solo or budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A thief among them....”
Reviews.Author: nytauro
Reviews.Content: Although the room was dissapointing the receptionists and were so pleasant and the breakfast good I would have planned to return. After offering to hold my baggage for a week while I went to Poland I returned to find that the lock had been broken and that I had been the victim of a criminal theft. My dissapointment lies in the fact that NOT ONCE had management contacted me to accept responsibility or apologize. The theft became secondary to the fact that the incident was NVER acknowledged. What a pity!

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funkster111
Reviews.Content: I really liked Hotel Julia because of it's convenient location. 2 blocks from the metro station by Piazza Barberini. Free internet service. It's about a 2.5 star hotel, and it fit my needs and budget adequately. If you are looking for fancy hotel, or on your honeymoon, i'd skip this place, but if you are on a travel budget like my friends, and want to be in a good location, this is a great hotel. I loved it. and there are so many restaurants nearby to choose from and lots of shopping nearby. My experience here was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Don2814
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days at the Hotel Julia. The hotel was not shabby and filthy...it was very clean. The best feature is the location, within easy walking distance to everything in Rome....Trevi Ftn is within five minutes. Breakfast was excellent and the staff was so very friendly, helpful for directions, and spoke English. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Filthy and NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BYO
Reviews.Content: We read mixed reviews of this hotel and went with an open mind considering we had traveled to Italy before. We were really disappointed with this hotel because it had a really horrible room. It was dirty, with stained bedsheets. The room was really dark and horribly lit. The Breakfast was really disgusting since the food wasnt fresh. The towels in the room were dirty and stained. The service was really bad. The reception was really rude and didnt want to speak English to us. They also lied and said we had free internet access on the website. But when we asked about it, they said they were going to charge us but would be willing to give us 10 minutes free (on the main desk computer) after we complained about the service. At night we heard noises in the dark. It could be argued that it was our imagination. We checked out right away the next morning. We will never go back there when we visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, and it was out Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: OnlytheFacts
Reviews.Content: Absolutely shocking. FACT - I booked Domus Julia a 16th century Italian Palace apartment FACT - I was given a really shabby room in Hotel Julia. Domus Julia and Hotel Julia are two doors away from each other and are both owned by the same person FACT - I wasn't told about the change of hotel/room when I arrived, despite asking them twice if I had the right room!! I only discovered that I'd been conned two days later FACT - I offered to only pay for 3 nights instead of 4 to make up for the fact I'd spent my honeymoon in such a shabby room FACT - After being threatened by them that they would call the police and following a tirade of abuse from their rude reception/management staff they agreed to let me pay for three nights, not four. I signed for 3 nights and quickly made my exit with my wife. FACT - When I returned home they had illegally taken two transactions from my account, one for three-nights (which I'd signed for) and the other a sum equivalent to the fourth-night they had agreed I could have for free FACT - They tried to fob Mastercard off by explaining it was a charge for not showing up on the first night, which was a lie FACT - I got my money back. In conclusion, I'd avoid these like the plague, it really isn't worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for 4 days. The staff went out of their way for us, making sure we had breakfast an hour before it was due to be served when we had a tour to meet. The breakfast included boiled eggs, several flavors of yogurt, yummy danishes (including chocolate!) and plenty of hot coffee. The air conditioner always worked down to 20 degrees C, there was a safe in the room, the rooms were clean and quiet, and the bed comfortable. I found the 2nd pillow on the last day of my stay, tucked away in a drawer, bonus! What more could you want? The hotel is one block from the subway stop, everything was within reach. While this is more pricey than I am accustomed to spend on a hotel, I never visit large cities, so it seemed like a good value to me. The price is worth it because it saved so much wear and tear on my feet to be so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before you read this you have to understand our mentality while we were traveling in Italy. We were there to see the incredible sites...not to stay in a glamourous hotel. That being said, I still think this hotel was great. The location is incredible. It's on a deceptively cool little street right in the heart of rome (10 min walk to Trevi, 25 to Colosseum). Overall, the place was nice. Friendly staff, good breakfast. Free internet behind the front desk. The only prob we had was that our room reaked of smoke, but that went away after leaving the windows open for a bit. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome in late Feb. 2006 for 3 nights. I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I'm telling you right now, for the price, you can not beat the location. As they say, location, location location is everything. You are in the heart of Rome, and don't have to walk far to get to many of sights and sounds of Rome. Trevi Fountain, not even a 5 minute walk. Spanish Steps possibly 10minutes. Campalognia maybe a 20 minute walk. Plaza Navarro maybe another 5 -7minute walk. Granted I went to Rome during the off season, so the streets weren't as crowded as they could be but they were crowded due to the Olympics being in Italy. For bad reviews of the room I just don't understand what most folks are looking for. As anyone knows most true European hotel rooms are not spacious like in the United States. But it was quiet and my room had a sink and toilet in it. The check in people were really nice especially Stephan and Ann. Their english is very good, but I watched all the agents speak in various different languages. The continental breakfast was tasty. Nothing to rave about, but kept me full for most of the day. Croissant, bread, cheese, salami, fruit coffee, juice and cold cereal like cornflakes. For the money, I think staying here is well worth it, and have already planned another stay here in November.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay, bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Mama2BEA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my cousin and our 3 kids between Christmas and New Years. We had a triple, that consisted of a double and a single. My son and my cousin had a double down the hall. The triple was pretty large- the same with the bathroom. The double much smaller, but not cramped. The rooms were a bit worn, but everything functioned well and breakfast (including cappuccino) was fine. Basically salami, breads, some fruit. We even got cappuccino from the bar in the evenings. The staff was quite friendly allowing us to check in early as we came in on the night train from Munich. They also kept our bags for us the last day as our train did not leave until that night. Hotels in Rome being fairly expensive anyway, this one was ok, though I did feel it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Skip Hotel Julia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. A friend of a friend recommended this hotel. She must be on crack because this hotel was awful. For starters there were trash bins directly in front. The carpet throughout the hotel was filthy and the rooms are extremely small. They had the nerve to classify this hotel as a three star, but it was more like a one star. The price was way too high - - 180 euros a night. I feel completely ripped off. There was only 1 nice thing, and I do mean 1 nice thing I can say about this hotel and that was the location. It was near Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. But, there are several other nice hotels in this area ( I checked them out!!!) that are much nicer for the price you pay. Do yourself a favor, skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price you can do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Julia October 21st 2005 for one night on our way to Tuscany and again on Oct 28th 2005, leaving Rome. The first night we actually had the room in the picture on the website, nice room except it is located just above the front door to the hotel. All night long people were standing just under the window talking loudly. If it wasen't guests it was the night staff talking on their cell phone. An extremly loud place. When we left, we requested a room on the quiteter side of the building for our return the next week. We had two identical rooms both were extremely small and the bathrooms were old and crummy. The showers were 18 inchs square, really, really small and the shower doors only opened about 12 inches. I had to stand sideways just to get into it, forget about washing your feet you could not bend in that shower. Anyone just a little overweight would not be able to get into the shower. The hallways were dark and dirty and the floors felt weak and uneven under the carpets. These rooms were quiter then the first night. For 160 Euros I think you can do better. The area is full of nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Was better than we expected after reading trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, but there are problems with mosquitos ( and you cannot get ac so you must keep windows open). Breakfast not as good as others at same price and no cappucino is provided.ù free internet access and wonderful staff . Also, you must come and go together because only one key and key is needed to put on electricity in the room. But great location near Plaza Barberini. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in! * Tiny tiny shabby rooms. Can hear everything through the walls. * Having booked a twin room, were presented with a double (tiny queen bed for 2 friends to share). When we explained we had booked a room with 2 beds we were told there would be nothing available for 2 days! No apology, nothing! * The staff (esp one female in particular) were extremely rude! In fact reducing one of our party to tears! * Having traveled around all of Italy we were very tired on arriving and needed a much deserved lie in. This was remarked upon by the staff - I felt like I had brought my mother along! Incredibly rude - as a paying guest you should be able to do as you wish as regards gtting up early or late! * We finally changed rooms (for one with twin beds). This room had single beds the size of camp beds. On of the beds sloped to the side - on closer inpection half of the inside of the matress had desintegrated!! I don't want to know how! We now felt that we couldn't complain as had been made to feel so bad the first time. * Breakfast - was actually nice. There is one problem though - It is a battle to get food. Everyone piles in around these small tables to get their continental breakfast and pour their own coffee. * Good location - Near Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. There are so many hotels in Rome, please please don't stay here!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Julia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Rasella 29, 00187 Rome, Italy
